business.headline:
Treated like strangers: Sunjay Kapur's sister alleges family sidelined by companyMandhira Kapur Smith alleged that the family has been treated as strangers, adding that the names of family
members were not included in obituaries and public acknowledgments.

Should you let AI analyse your online spending habits?Artificial intelligence is gradually slipping into our wallets. From tracking what we buy to predicting our next expense, AI-based tools are becoming popular. But should you really let AI analyse your online spending habits?

Trade deal talks hit roadblock as US delegation's India visit could be delayedThe India-US trade deal talks face a potential roadblock as the US delegation may delay its August 25 visit to India. This postponement impacts scheduled negotiations that were crucial for preventing additional tariffs. A 50% tariff on Indian goods is set to take effect from August 27. Currently, a 25% tariff is already in place, impacting exporters. The deferment of the meeting does not signify cancellation, but rather a delay. Reasons for the delay could be operational or related to geopolitical outcomes. "A 50% tariff will be imposed on us from August 27 in totality." The BTA deal is anticipated by the end of September or October, with expectations for a meeting by the end of August, contingent on geopolitical developments.

Trade deal in limbo as US team's India visit deferred amid tariff warThe United States has been pressing India to open its agriculture and dairy sectors, but New Delhi has ruled out concessions, saying such moves would endanger small farmers and cattle rearers.

Real wallet-friendly shake-up: GST 2.0 to feel like 'Good and Simple Tax'The government is set to launch GST 2.0 with major rate cuts, making essentials cheaper and simplifying tax slabs. The overhaul promises lower prices, fewer complications, and a true 'Good and Simple Tax'.

What nobody tells you about buying motor insuranceWhile car sales are climbing, many buyers remain unaware about the finer points of motor insurance, a gap that can cost them money and create problems when making a claim.

Government proposes 5%, 18% GST slabs; tobacco at 40%, relief for farmers: SourcesThe government has proposed reducing GST to two slabs: 5% and 18% with sin goods at 40%, aiming to cut taxes on essentials like farm products, health items, handicrafts, and insurance.

Credit ratings decoded: How a simple upgrade can change a country's fortuneGlobal credit rating agency S&P Global has upgraded India's long-term unsolicited sovereign credit rating to 'BBB' from 'BBB-'.

GST council meeting in September, 12% slam may be dropped: SourcesTwo-day GST Council meetings are expected in September to pave the way for reforms. The announcement was made by the Prime Minister from the ramparts of the Red Fort. These reforms are seen as a Diwali gift for the middle class. Key changes include the removal of the 12% GST slab and rate rationalisation for health and life insurance policies. The government aims to reduce the GST on most items currently in the 12% slab to 5%. This move is expected to make essential items such as footwear, bags, clothes, and toothpastes more affordable. The government is addressing concerns about inflation and the rising cost of living. Feedback regarding health insurance, which impacts the common person, has also been considered. The meetings in September are crucial for approving these changes, with implementation anticipated before Diwali. The Finance Ministry and state finance ministers have been involved in the process.

GST Council may drop 12% slab, more tax reforms in September meeting: SourcesThe meeting comes after Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his Independence Day speech, announced plans for a major overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) system.

Claiming bias, same-sex couple approaches court over uneven tax: ReportThe petition was admitted by a bench of Justice BP Colabawalla and Justice Firdoush Pooniwalla, which has also issued a notice to the Attorney General as the case raises a constitutional question.

PM Modi announces next-generation GST reform with significantly lower ratesDuring his Independence Day address, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a sweeping overhaul of the GST system, promising to unveil a "next-generation" tax regime with substantially lower rates this Diwali, which he hailed as a festive gift from the Centre.

Rs 15,000 from government on 1st private-sector job: PM's big youth schemePM Modi in his Independence Day speech said that the Pradhan Mantri Viksit Bharat Rojgar Yojana will create nearly 3.5 crore new employment opportunities for the youth.

GST cut coming soon? What to expect after PM Modi's big Diwali promisePrime Minister Narendra Modi's announcement has set expectations for a substantial overhaul of the current multi-slab GST structure, which has been in place since 2017.

India to roll out its own semiconductor chips by end of 2025: PM ModiSpeaking on the country's 79th Independence Day, PM Modi hoisted the national flag for the 12th consecutive time before outlining the government's plans for technology, energy, and economic reforms.

PM's Double Diwali promise, says next-generation GST with much lower taxes soonPrime Minister Narendra Modi promised the roll-out a next-generation GST regime with substantially lower taxes before this Diwali, calling it a major festive gift to benefit individuals, MSMEs, and the economy.

5 IPOs to open for bidding next week: Which is best based on GMP?Next week will see the IPOs of Patel Retail, Vikram Solar, Gem Aromatics, Shreeji Shipping Global and Mangal Electrical. Together, they are looking to raise Rs 3,584.09 crore from the market.

Why your 45-day credit card grace period might be a debt trap, explains CAMany believe a credit card's 45-day grace period means free borrowing time. But as an expert explains, even a small unpaid balance can turn it into a costly debt trap.

Sensex, Nifty end marginally higher as investors await Trump-Putin meet outcomeThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 57.75 points to end at 80,597.66, while the NSE Nifty50 added just 11.95 points to close at 24,631.30.

S&P upgrades India's sovereign rating to 'BBB' on growth, fiscal disciplineThe move comes more than a year after S&P revised India's outlook to positive from stable in May 2024, on the back of robust growth and improved expenditure quality. The rating agency also revised India's transfer and convertibility assessment to 'A-' from 'BBB+'.

Fresh scrutiny on FedEx, UPS, DHL top brass in antitrust case: ReportExecutives set to be questioned include Subhasish Chakraborty, Managing Director of DTDC Express; R.S. Subramanian, Managing Director of DHL Express India, and more.

7 major income tax changes in 2025 that will impact your money2025 has brought a wave of changes to India's income tax rules, from bigger exemptions to extended filing deadlines. Here's a simple breakdown of the seven key updates that could directly affect your finances.

Cognizant to roll out wage hikes for 80% of eligible employees. Details hereIT giant Cognizant is set to give salary hikes to 80% of eligible employees from November 1, with top performers in India receiving high single-digit increases.

JSW Cement shares fall after listing at 4% premium: Should you hold or sell?JSW Cement's share price listed at 4% above its issue price of Rs 147. On the BSE, the stock opened at Rs 153, up 4.1%, while on the NSE it debuted at Rs 153.50, a gain of 4.4%.

Man invested Rs 18,000/month for 4 years, earned less than FDs. CA explains whyThe investor believed he was on the right track. His funds showed a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 11%. But when he calculated his portfolio XIRR—the actual return on his money—it was just 6%. That's less than the 7% a fixed deposit would have paid over the same period.
Pakistan's credit rating gets a lift from Moody's. Here's whyS&P Global Ratings raised Pakistan's rating to B- from CCC+ on July 24, while Fitch Ratings did the same in April.

RBI's new rule: Cheques to clear in just hours starting this dateUnder the new rule, cheques will be scanned, presented, and cleared continuously during business hours, reducing the clearing cycle from the current T+1 days to just a few hours.

ICICI Bank cuts minimum balance after backlash. Check new rules and penaltiesThe bank's decision comes after strong public criticism, particularly over the earlier increase in urban and metro monthly average balance levels.
JSW Cement shares list at 4% premium on stock market debut On the BSE, the shares opened at Rs 153, up 4.1%, while on the NSE they began trading at Rs 153.50, a gain of 4.4%.

Muthoot Finance shares jump 10% to hit record high after Q1 results. Should you buy?The gold loan financing company has seen its stock lifted by strong quarterly performance, rising investor confidence, and positive brokerage recommendations. Shares of the company were trading 10.43% higher at Rs 2,772.55 on the BSE at 10:04 am.
Bitcoin surges past $124,000 to hit all-time high. What's fueling the rally?Bitcoin hit an all-time high of $124,000. Here's why Bitcoin surged past $124K and will it keep climbing?

Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT stocks rally; Infosys, Wipro among top gainersThe S&P BSE Sensex opened more than 100 points higher and was trading 51.75 points up at 80,591.66 around 9:25 am. The NSE Nifty50 rose 13.80 points to 24,633.15.

Gujarat's textile industry threatened by 50% US tariffs demands 10% export incentiveIndia's total textile exports to the US are valued at USD 10–12 billion annually, with Gujarat accounting for more than 15 per cent of that trade.

Mumbai regulatory body acts against Palais Royale developer over Rs 100 crore duesMahaRERA's adjudicating officer has now issued recovery warrants under Section 40(1) of the RERA Act, enabling the District Collector to recover the amount as arrears of land revenue.

US tariff impact will be temporary, private sector should step up: Chief economistChief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran attributed the growth slowdown in FY25, which saw a deceleration to 6.5 per cent from FY24's 9.2 per cent, to tight credit conditions and liquidity issues.

ICICI Bank lowers minimum balance for savings accounts after outrageThe new minimum average balance thresholds are as follows: Rs 15,000 for customers in metro and urban areas, Rs 7,500 for semi-urban customers, and Rs 2,500 for those in rural locations.

5 credit score myths you should stop believingYour credit score can open doors to better loans and credit cards, or shut them. Yet, many people still rely on half-truths and hearsay. Let's separate fact from fiction.

Sebi eases rules for foreign investors: Here's all you need to knowSebi plans to introduce simpler rules to make it easier for foreign investors to enter India's markets. The move aims to cut compliance burdens and attract more long-term overseas capital.

Indians sent abroad enough money in a decade to build 62 IITs, says RBI dataIn 2023–24 alone, students remitted about Rs 29,000 crore abroad for their studies, almost the same as the previous year. A decade ago, this figure was just Rs 2,429 crore.

Unified Pension Scheme offers security, but why aren't employees joining?With assured monthly income and inflation protection, UPS should have been an instant hit. Instead, uptake has been lukewarm. Here's why.

entertainment.headline: Actor Terence Stamp, who played Superman villain General Zod, dies at 87Actor Terence Stamp, known for his role as General Zod, has died aged 87. He also played a key role in actor Tom Cruise's World War 2 period-drama 'Valkyrie' (2008).

Veteran Marathi actor Jyoti Chandekar dies at 68 after prolonged illnessVeteran Marathi actor Jyoti Chandekar, known for her role as Poorna Aji in 'Tharala Tar Mag', died in Pune at the age of 68 after a long illness. Her daughter Tejaswini Pandit and the Marathi film industry remembered her for her long and memorable career.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui opens up on his bond with daughter Shora: My biggest criticActor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said his daughter Shora keeps him grounded and often scolds him without caring about his stardom.

Janhvi-Sidharth relish Lucknow chaat ahead of Param Sundari release. VideoJanhvi Kapoor and Sidharth Malhotra enjoyed chaat in Lucknow while promoting their upcoming film 'Param Sundari'. The romantic drama, releasing on August 29, has already created buzz with its trailer and the duo's on-screen chemistry.

Men should rule: Kerala actor's sexist rant after film body elects woman headThe Malayalam film body elected Shwetha Menon as its first female president, marking a landmark moment in Malayalam cinema. However, veteran Kollam Thulasi's sexist remarks have overshadowed the celebration, reigniting debates on industry sexism.

Boney Kapoor shows off his age-old outfits, Janhvi has the sweetest reactionBoney Kapoor impressed fans on Instagram by posing in a stylish look featuring his 22-year-old jeans and 18-year-old shirt, paired with a fresh haircut. His daughter Janhvi Kapoor added a sweet "Wow papa" comment, while fans showered him with love and nostalgic messages.

Bads of Bollywood X reactions: Aryan Khan's glimpse gives fans full SRK deja vuAryan Khan's upcoming web series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' first teaser sparked widespread attention. The series, written and directed by Aryan Khan, features a star-studded cast and is backed by Gauri Khan, promising a stylised entertainment world.

Fahadh Faasil recalls losing film with Oscar-winning director Alejandro InarrituFahadh Faasil shared that he was once in talks for a film with Hollywood director Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu but couldn't take it up because of accent issues. He added that he wants his most special projects to come from Malayalam cinema itself.

Why Salman Khan's Sikandar failed? AR Murugadoss admits missteps in executionSalman Khan's 'Sikandar', directed by AR Murugadoss, has underperformed at the box office despite high expectations. Murugadoss admitted the emotional story did not connect with audiences and expressed hope to return to Bollywood when he finds his comfort zone.

Dipika Kakar shares health update, says cancer treatment hits hard and heavyDipika Kakar, who underwent a major surgery for stage 2 liver cancer in June, recently shared a heartfelt health update with fans, admitting that treatment days often feel heavy.

Coolie box office Day 3: Rajinikanth film storms past Rs 250 crore worldwideRajinikanth's 'Coolie' continues its unstoppable run at the box office, raking in Rs 158.25 crore domestically in just three days. The film has become the highest-grossing Tamil release of 2025.

War 2 box office Day 3: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR film witnesses a sharp dropOn Day 3, 'War 2' collected around Rs 33 crore in India, bringing its three-day total to nearly Rs 143–144 crore. Despite the dip, Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's film has crossed Rs 200 crore worldwide and emerged as the seventh highest-grossing Bollywood release of 2025.

Parag Tyagi gets wife Shefali Jariwala's face tattooed on his chest. VideoParag Tyagi paid a heartfelt tribute to his late wife Shefali Jariwala by getting her portrait tattooed on his chest, keeping her memory close to his heart.

Vijay Deverakonda represents India at New York's India Day parade. WatchActor Vijay Deverakonda celebrated Independence Day by proudly representing India at the India Day parade in New York City. He participated in flag-hoisting ceremonies and greeted fans at Times Square.

Nakuul Mehta, wife Jankee welcome baby girl share adorable pics from hospitalActor Nakuul Mehta and his wife Jankee have welcomed their second child, a baby girl, sharing the joyous news with fans through a heartfelt Instagram post. The couple's son Sufi was lovingly included in the announcement, holding his newborn sister in the first picture.

Jaideep Ahlawat's impromptu bhangra steals the show at IFFM 2025, fans want moreJaideep Ahlawat set the stage on fire with his impromptu bhangra at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2025, leaving the audience and Malaika Arora cheering for more. The actor also bagged the Best Actor - Web Series award for his role in 'Paatal Lok 2'.

Aryan Khan flips the script with his bold Bads of Bollywood first lookAryan Khan's 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' teaser has generated excitement by blending love and critique of Bollywood, with the show slated for release in 2025.

How Coolie fever gripped India 40 years agoWhile Rajinikanth-starrer Coolie might seem to break all the fandom craze, India saw something similar, if not more, in 1983 when Amitabh Bachchan's Coolie hit the theatres. It was during the shooting of Coolie that Big B sustained a life-threatening injury and the whole country prayed for him. So, when the film was released, anticipation was sky-high and fans turned theatres into temples for Amitabh worship.

Anita Advani says she secretly married Rajesh Khanna: He made me wear mangal sutraAnita Advani has revealed that she was privately married to the late Bollywood superstar Rajesh Khanna, adding a new dimension to his personal life story.

general news.headline: 'Forget Nato, Crimea': Is Trump throwing Zelenskyy under the bus for Russia deal?Ahead of his meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European leaders at the White House, US President Donald Trump on Monday ruled out the possibility of Kyiv reclaiming Crimea from Moscow and urged his counterpart not to pursue Nato membership — a key sticking point with Russia.

US keeps an eye on India-Pakistan situation every single day: Marco RubioUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the United States monitors the India-Pakistan situation daily and stressed that maintaining a ceasefire is often challenging, especially after long conflicts.

BJP picks Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan as NDA Veep candidateThe BJP has announced Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan as NDA's Vice Presidential candidate after Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned last month citing health reasons.

House No. 0 to name duplications: Poll body's big counter to Rahul GandhiThe Election Commission of India (ECI) on Sunday countered Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's "vote chori" or vote theft allegations, by explaining how thousands of voters had zero as house numbers and that duplication in voter list didn't mean fraud. It vouched for the sanctity of the electoral rolls and said the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise in Bihar wasn't being done in a rush.
Are weightloss drugs for me? 5 things to considerAnti-obesity drugs like GLP-1 are quite popular now. But, do you really need it?

Putin agrees to explore NATO-style security guarantees for Ukraine: Trump envoyPutin agreed in principle with Trump on possible NATO-style security guarantees for Ukraine, envoy Witkoff said, though Rubio cautioned details remain unresolved as European leaders prepare for White House talks.

Why US spares China, but hits India: Marco Rubio explains dilemma on Russian oilSpeaking to Fox News on August 17, Marco Rubio cautioned that targeting Chinese refiners would have disruptive consequences for the global oil market.

Neither I, Tejashwi, nor Bihar...: Rahul Gandhi slams BJP over poll panel presserRahul Gandhi accused the Election Commission and the BJP of conducting a major electoral fraud and claimed that the constitutional rights of citizens were being snatched away. Gandhi was addressing the people as part of the ongoing Vote Adhikar Yatra in Bihar.
Who messed up Lionel Messi's Kerala visit?Whether it's the Pinarayi Vijayan government to blame or the Argentinian Football Association, the ordinary football fan in Kerala lies crestfallen

Give affidavit in 7 days or apologise: Poll body to Rahul Gandhi on 'vote chori'The Election Commission has asked Rahul Gandhi to either submit an affidavit within seven days backing his 'vote chori' claims or apologise to the nation.

Treated like strangers: Sunjay Kapur's sister alleges family sidelined by companyMandhira Kapur Smith alleged that the family has been treated as strangers, adding that the names of family
members were not included in obituaries and public acknowledgments.

Who is CP Radhakrishnan, NDA's pick for Vice PresidentMaharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan, who began his political career as an RSS swayamsevak, was named as NDA's candidate for the upcoming Vice Presidential election. Here's all you need to know about him.

Poll panel's theft caught: Non-INDIA bloc AAP backs Congress on 'vote chori' claimAAP has accused the Election Commission of colluding with the BJP and indulging in "vote chori" ahead of the Bihar Assembly elections, even as it distances itself from the INDIA bloc.

Mohun Bagan's Jason Cummings shows middle finger after losing to East BengalMohun Bagan's Jason Cummings sparked a controversy with his middle finger gesture after losing 1-2 to East Bengal in the quarterfinal of the Durand Cup.

Akhilesh Yadav says had filed affidavit, shows receipts to counter poll bodySamajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav accused the Election Commission of India of denying receipt of Samajwadi Party's affidavits in Uttar Pradesh.

Case against Vivek Agnihotri over Gopal Mukherjee's portrayal in 'Bengal Files'The film's trailer introduces Gopal Patha as "Ek Tha Kashai Gopal Patha", which Shantanu claims is a misrepresentation of his grandfather's character. Shantanu asserts that his grandfather was not a butcher by profession, but rather a wrestler and a key figure in the Anushilan Samiti, who played a crucial role in preventing Muslim League riots in 1946.

Watch: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma share moment of laughter with locals in LondonStar India batter Virat Kohli was seen having a stroll on the London streets along with his Bollywood actor wife Anushka Sharma. The duo also had a light-hearted conversation with the locals.

Vice-president poll: How Modi's playbook defies pundits, past precedenceModi values messaging—not just to Parliament or BJP cadre but to the electorate at large. But this time, his choice will also take the RSS view into account
Election Commission releases list of 65 lakh voters deleted from Bihar draft rollsElection Commission releases list of 65 lakh voters deleted from draft rolls in Bihar after top court order
AI engineer Varun Gupta fined $34,000 for leaking Intel secrets to MicrosoftAccording to the reports, Varun Gupta leaked thousands of files from Intel to Microsoft.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui opens up on his bond with daughter Shora: My biggest criticActor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said his daughter Shora keeps him grounded and often scolds him without caring about his stardom.
Yamuna may cross danger mark in two days, government issues flood advisoryAccording to the advisory, the river is expected to cross the 206-metre danger level by 2 am on August 19.

With this treasure...: Asim Munir's 'rare earth' boast after oil deal with USAsim Munir's remarks come after US officials expressed interest in Pakistan's mineral reserves, which are vital for the electronics and defence sectors, as Washington seeks to break away from Chinese hegemony and reduce its dependency on Beijing's supply chains amid rising uncertainties.

Asia Cup 2025: Should India risk Jasprit Bumrah ahead of home Tests?India's Asia Cup title defence can work out well despite the absence of Jasprit Bumrah. However, his presence will be needed for the important Tests and the T20 World Cup 2026. Given the fragility of his body, will it be ideal to make him play the Asia Cup 2025?

The romantic drama, releasing on August 29, has already created buzz with its trailer and the duo's on-screen chemistry.

However, veteran Kollam Thulasi's sexist remarks have overshadowed the celebration, reigniting debates on industry sexism.

sports.headline: Mohun Bagan's Jason Cummings shows middle finger after losing to East BengalMohun Bagan's Jason Cummings sparked a controversy with his middle finger gesture after losing 1-2 to East Bengal in the quarterfinal of the Durand Cup.

Amorim's new-look United fall 0-1 to Arsenal at Old TraffordManchester United's Premier League opener ended in disappointment as Ruben Amorim's men lost 1-0 to Arsenal at Old Trafford. Ricardo Calafiori's header proved decisive, leaving United frustrated despite dominating large spells of the game.

Babar and Rizwan aren't Pakistan's key players; they don't win matches: HafeezFormer Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez has criticised Mohammad Rizwan and Babar Azam for not being the key players for their team due to their inability to help them win big matches in recent times.

East Bengal take 2-1 win vs Mohun Bagan, Diamantakos' brace seals derby winEast Bengal beat Mohun Bagan 2-1 in a fiery Kolkata Derby to reach the Durand Cup quarterfinals. Dimitrios Diamantakos scored twice, while Anirudh Thapa netted for the Mariners, but East Bengal's resilience sealed a morale-boosting early-season win.

Watch: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma share moment of laughter with locals in LondonStar India batter Virat Kohli was seen having a stroll on the London streets along with his Bollywood actor wife Anushka Sharma. The duo also had a light-hearted conversation with the locals.

Carey enjoying gloveless role for Australia in ODIs with Inglis' riseAlex Carey has seamlessly transitioned from a specialist wicketkeeper to a specialist batter in ODIs, embracing whatever role the team requires. After being Australia's first-choice keeper for nearly five years, Josh Inglis has replaced him.

Criticism will come and go, winning matters: Shardul defends Gautam GambhirIndia coach Gautam Gambhir has faced sharp criticism after recent Test setbacks, but Shardul Thakur has defended him, praising his fighting spirit and influence on the team. With the Asia Cup ahead, Gambhir's leadership remains under the spotlight.

Don't push Bumrah towards early retirement, he's Kohinoor Diamond: Former openerFormer India opener Aakash Chopra has warned against pushing Jasprit Bumrah towards early retirement amid constant criticism of the India fast bowler.

Alyssa Healy, Australia brace for tough spin challenge in Women's World CupAlyssa Healy acknowledged the tough spin-friendly conditions Australia will face at the Women's ODI World Cup. Having returned from injury, Healy is in excellent form, finishing as the top run-scorer in both the T20 and One-Day series against India A.

Khalid Jamil lifts lid on Chhetri snub: Wanted different faces in CAFA CupKhalid Jamil's first India squad raised eyebrows with the omission of Sunil Chhetri, as the new coach prioritises fresh faces for the CAFA Nations Cup, sparking questions about the legendary striker's long-term international future.

Asia Cup 2025: R. Ashwin gives his verdict on Shubman Gill vs Jaiswal debateFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has shared his views on the Shubman Gill vs Yashasvi Jaiswal debate for the upcoming Asia Cup 2025. The two players are in contention to be the backup opener for the continental tournament.

Asia Cup 2025: R. Ashwin gives his verdict on Shubman Gill vs Jaiswal debateFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has shared his views on the Shubman Gill vs Yashasvi Jaiswal debate for the upcoming Asia Cup 2025. The two players are in contention to be the backup opener for the continental tournament.

Bangladesh umpire Shathira Jakir Jessy set for historic World Cup stintFormer cricketer Shathira Jakir Jessy will become the first Bangladeshi woman umpire to officiate in a senior World Cup at the Women's ODI World Cup in India. Jessy, who has officiated in various international tournaments, is excited for the opportunity after years of hard work.

I stick to what I believe in: Shoaib Bashir responds to Nathan Lyon's jibeEngland spinner Shoaib Bashir has dismissed Nathan Lyon's critique, insisting he will focus on his own growth ahead of the Ashes. Inspired by Lyon's craft, the 21-year-old aims to recover fully and play a key role in England's bid to reclaim the urn.

Pakistan's T20 team can beat India: Aqib Javed's bold claim for Asia CupSelector Aqib Javed expressed confidence in Pakistan's ability to beat India in the Asia Cup 2025, praising the strength of the current squad. Despite India's dominant T20I record, Pakistan aims to repeat their 2022 Asia Cup success in the upcoming clash on September 14.

Mitchell Johnson slams Cricket Australia CEO's take on lesser Test matchesMitchell Johnson has slammed calls to restrict Test cricket to elite nations, urging the ICC and boards to "stop hoarding the privilege and start sharing the responsibility." He says the format's future lies in support, not exclusion.

Rohit Sharma has class to play till 45, make him run 10km every day: Yograj SinghFormer India all-rounder Yograj Singh has slammed Rohit Sharma's critics amid the recent reports of his retirement and urged the cricketer to work on his fitness claiming that he has the ability to play till 45.

Babar Azam has been asked to improve his strike-rate: Mike HessonPakistan head coach Mike Hesson explained that Babar Azam was left out of the Asia Cup squad due to concerns over his strike rate and performance against spin in T20s, areas where he has been asked to improve.

Pujara backs Ashwin as future India coach after stellar careerCheteshwar Pujara, one of India's most dependable Test batters, believes Ravichandran Ashwin has all the qualities to become the national team's coach in the years ahead.

Thomas Frank hails Richarlison's impact, warns about his injury woesTottenham manager Thomas Frank hailed Richarlison's stunning display against Burnley but urged caution over his fitness, stressing the need to manage him carefully.

When Kolkata stops, it's only for East Bengal vs Mohun Bagan DerbyWhen East Bengal and Mohun Bagan face off, Kolkata doesn't just watch — it holds its breath. Ninety minutes of chaos, colour, and history where football isn't sport, but identity played loud.

Australia vs South Africa ODI series: Squads, all you need to knowAUS vs SA: Australia and South Africa will face off in a three-match ODI series from August 19–24, marking their first bilateral ODI series in Australia since 2018. With World Cup preparations underway, both squads feature strong lineups in what promises to be a tightly contested clash.

Tamil Thalaivas aim for a change in fortunes with revamped squad and new coachTamil Thalaivas aim for their maiden PKL title in Season 12 with Arjun Deshwal, Pawan Sehrawat, and coach Sanjeev Baliyan leading the charge.

Fabio equals Shilton's record for most appearances in football historyGoalkeeper Fabio has reached 1,390 career matches, equalling former England goalkeeper Peter Shilton as the record holder for the most games in football history.

Alyssa Healy's 137 gives Australia A consolation win in 3rd Women's One-DayerAlyssa Healy's blistering 137 not out powered Australia A to a dominant nine-wicket win over India A in the third one-dayer, avoiding a series whitewash. Despite the loss, India A sealed the series 2-1.

Watch: Wolves' emotional tifo tribute for Diogo Jota leaves his family in tearsWolves fans unveiled a powerful tifo for Diogo Jota at Molineux, moving his family to tears. Former teammates, Manchester City players, and football leaders joined to honour the late star's legacy across English and European football.

FIFA supports Semenyo after racist abuse in Premier League openerBournemouth forward Antoine Semenyo has received backing from FIFA's Players' Voice Panel after being subjected to racist abuse during Friday's Premier League opener against Liverpool at Anfield.

Terence Atmane gifts Jannik Sinner Pokemon card on 24th birthdayFrench qualifier Terence Atmane surprised Jannik Sinner with a rare Pikachu card for his 24th birthday before their Cincinnati Open semi-final. Sinner dominated the match, winning 7–6 (4), 6–2 with 91 per cent first-serve success.

From tea stall to PKL glory: Puneri Paltan captain Aslam Inamdar gunning for moreFrom working in a tea stall to leading Puneri Paltan to their maiden Pro Kabaddi League title, Aslam Inamdar recalls his journey in the sport. Inamdar talks about his return from injury as he looks for more success in the upcoming season.

UFC 319: Khamzat Chimaev dominates Dricus du Plessis to win Middleweight titleKhamzat Chimaev dethroned Dricus du Plessis at UFC 319 with a dominant unanimous decision to become the new Middleweight champion on Saturday, August 16.

Baby AB title is a big burden to carry: Maxwell dissects Dewald Brevis's riseGlenn Maxwell has hailed Dewald Brevis's stunning rise while admitting the 22-year-old has carried the heavy weight of being branded "Baby AB." From IPL redemption to a record T20I century, Brevis is finally making his own name.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
